reviewText:
Early Access Review

Survivor: The Living Dead's promied additional content is really going to be the making of it. The groundwork is solid; at the moment, it's an enjoyable zombie defense title based on Romero's seminal 1968 movie in which you repel the undead menace from a two storey house by way of various weapons and traps. You begin in the reasonable 7 minute mode before heading into bumpier territory with th 12 and 14 minute challenges, unlocking multiple bonus weapons and gameplay variables as you go.
The controls need tweaking. The mapping is fine and feels comfortable but command areas for certain item pick-ups and especially the stairs are a little too small to comfortably use in the middle of a zombie panic. Dev also needs a fullscreen fix as soon as possible as the text is a nightmare to read in the tiny windowed mode that Survivor boots in.
Easy thumbs up at this stage though. Plenty of potential.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4SvXO-W3KoE

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer: I was provided a key by the developer for a review

I just beat the 7 minute mode and this game seems promising. Basically this game consists of finding weapons/supplies or keys to unlock more weapons and supplies. Certain weapons are best suited for crowd control or single target and managing use of your resources carefully is crucial to beating the game. After beating the 7 minute mode, you unlock upgrades to your ammo capacity + small health and running meter upgrades which seem essential for surviving the longer modes. I did not like how you could get stun locked by several zombies, as when hit by one you drop your weapon and are stuck for a few seconds, and able to be immediately locked again if another zombie is nearby. Overall this game has a lot of potential and updates are still being done regularly.

For more recommendations on quality indie games or ones with high potential follow our group reviews  here

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Well aware of the ridiculously low amount of hours listed, but I assure anyone reading that I've actually been playing the game a fair bit ever since its original freeware release - I'd say the time I've spent is honestly closer to somewhere between 8 and 12.

Anyway! I do feel I can give the game a fair shake at this point.

Despite what you may expect from the screenshots, Survivor: The Living Dead" honestly feels more like an action-puzzle game that'll require some exploration and quick work on your part in order to do well in. You see

recommended: but we'll get to that) and you need to - very quickly - start searching the area for anything that can be used as a weapon

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pay no attention to my short time on this version, as I have played the freeware version some time ago.

This is an early access game that is in development, as such, it's purpose is to receive feedback from the community for bugtesting as well as overall design feedback. The game as it is now, is largely unchanged from the freeware version I played before so it is familiar. It is confirmed that there will be new levels coming, and from the Twitter, it looks like enemies and weapons too.

The game is more of a strategy/tower defense game with a twist. When the game starts it is up to you to fortify, find/create weapons and use some crafty tactics to use the environment as another weapon.

Again, I can't stress to people enough that this is still in development, but I am confident that through early access and feedback the game will be shaped to a much better final product. Give it a shot, once you get the hang of the game it is quite addictive with its additional modes and reward system, which is actually quite extensive.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A very well rounded action game that gets better as you learn your way around.

Your first playthrough will be confusing. You will die quickly. But you will pick up the game again and again and after numerous tries master the house and feel the joy of surviving the 7 minute mode...only to find out you have to beat 12 minutes now.

This is an old school" game in the sense that it is unforgiving
recommended: but very fun to master. You will die because of one slip up
hoursPlayed: you will die because of unlucky timing
voteText: you will die because you lost focus. But you will also feel great after executing an awesome combo
helpfulPercent: you will feel great after setting fire to dozen zombies at once
votesHelpful: you will feel great when you get an S-rank on all levels.\n\nIf the video sound remotely fun to you
votesTotal: then this is definitely worth checking out!\n\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Survivor: The Living Dead is an incomplete game with too high a price (at least for what it offers today ...)
NO Options , no support for the gamepad, no resolution or even full HD (16:9)
In terms of gameplay I found it a bit slow .. In short, today I have to give him a vote NEGATIVE, but I'm curious to see the full game so he can re-evaluate the review.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1UYkEIeHQhA
(Below is the Italian full review)  Survivor: The Living Dead è un gioco di sopravvivenza, dove bisogna utilizzare la propria astuzia e inteliggenti, riuscendo a sopravvivere il più possibile, facendo una carneficina di zombie!.


Feature:
Tante armi da utilizzare

Possibile utilizzare diversi approcci per la sopravvivenza

Stire retro


Parere personale:
Survivor: The Living Dead è un gioco incompleto con un prezzo troppo alto (almeno per quello che offre... oggi)
Opzioni insulse, nessun supporto al gamepad, nessuna risoluzione full hd e neanche i 16:9.
A livello di gameplay l'ho trovato un po lento.. insomma, ad oggi sono costretto a dargli un voto NEGATIVO, ma sono curioso di vedere il gioco completo, così da poter rivalutare la recensione.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is an excellent game. A love letter to the old Romero movies.

The first time you play you'll be trying to figure out how to survive using whatever you can lay your hands on...   And you'll probably die horribly.

Eventually, as you get good at the game and unlock all the items it becomes a different kind of game where you aggressively murder all the zombies you can.

At one point, well before the game came to steam, I threw together a 45 second trailer for the game, which would give you a very solid idea of what the game is like : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qfZc1U7bzHQ
